channel.title: Simple Chat Server v4

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:26, topic:365234”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=461438.msg3380711#msg3380711 date=1288003598]
If you use your own protocol, along side the IRC protocol you could add a huge list of support clients to your features.
[/quote]
Brb, re-implementing Pidgin messenger.

On a serious note, just take Mopar’s advice. Maybe do an IRC client though instead of a server; there’s a far greater chance of uptake if it’s open-source and comparable to X-Chat.[/quote]But it wont, it’ll be shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

eczema3:

If you use your own protocol, along side the IRC protocol you could add a huge list of support clients to your features.

Brb, re-implementing Pidgin messenger.

On a serious note, just take Mopar’s advice. Maybe do an IRC client though instead of a server; there’s a far greater chance of uptake if it’s open-source and comparable to X-Chat.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:365234”]As I said before, it’s all completely useless (except for a learning exercise, for you) unless you implement an existing standard, like IRC. Then I can actually comment on it. :)[/quote]Yes, as I said, if I continue this, that will be my next step.

Though personally I don’t see the point of writing an IRC server, aren’t they all basically the same? I don’t really see a lot of extra features you could add to one. The real changes are in the client.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

As I said before, it’s all completely useless (except for a learning exercise, for you) unless you implement an existing standard, like IRC. Then I can actually comment on it.

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:365234”] boolean found = false; String allUsernames = ""; int random = (int) (Math.random() * (20000)); if(random < 10000) { random += 10000; }
you’ll never guess what the default value of a declared boolean is…
i’m not even going to comment on how bad your concatenation method is
your method to create a random integer between 10000 and 20000 is just diabolical when the quickest way is so easy.

that’s just 6 lines from a method and i am already raging. I could honestly write a book on how bad it is.

ps, you wont be able to just “implement” the irc protocol because you’ll have to write everything from scratch since you’re protocol is completely different.[/quote]I lol’d at the first comment.
And yes, that was some of the same code that I had from many months ago, I could do better now. (in fact, I didn’t change that method one bit, so I’m not going to reply to the other parts of that)

As for implementing the IRC protocol, I’d only have to rewrite my package handling?

@c|p, when I said cc, I don’t mean pointing out everything wrong with it and leaving it at that, I mean giving some advice as to make it better.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:9, topic:365234”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=461438.msg3376407#msg3376407 date=1287634500]
Did most of your Java experience come from private servers? LoL
[/quote]

i never understood why this was bad, mine did and i turned out fine…, im taking AP computer science now, easiest shit ever all due to private server experience[/quote]…no.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:365234”] boolean found = false; String allUsernames = ""; int random = (int) (Math.random() * (20000)); if(random < 10000) { random += 10000; }
you’ll never guess what the default value of a declared boolean is…
i’m not even going to comment on how bad your concatenation method is
your method to create a random integer between 10000 and 20000 is just diabolical when the quickest way is so easy.

that’s just 6 lines from a method and i am already raging. I could honestly write a book on how bad it is.

ps, you wont be able to just “implement” the irc protocol because you’ll have to write everything from scratch since you’re protocol is completely different.[/quote]
a boolean only has a default value if it’s a field, not a local variable

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

               boolean found = false;
                String allUsernames = "";
                int random = (int) (Math.random() * (20000));
                if(random < 10000) {
                        random += 10000;
                }

i’m not even going to comment on how bad your concatenation method is
your method to create a random integer between 10000 and 20000 is just diabolical when the quickest way is so easy.

that’s just 6 lines from a method and i am already raging. I could honestly write a book on how bad it is.

ps, you wont be able to just “implement” the irc protocol because you’ll have to write everything from scratch since you’re protocol is completely different.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Davidi2:

Some real cc would be great

[quote=“super_, post:5, topic:365234”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461438.msg3375610#msg3375610 date=1287595354]
Some real cc would be great
[/quote]

The handywork looks poor, the wood is decaying, and the entire thing is full of asbestos[/quote]
valid.

Unhandled:

Your switch blocks, along with everything else, are so fucking bad.

valid.

Pwnd:

Did most of your Java experience come from private servers? LoL

valid.

Pwnd:

I’m just saying, because he obviously has adopted some of the bad habits associated with “programming” a private server.

valid.

this is atrocious – most of it is just taken straight out of a private server. it’s the exact same design, from what i can see no thought was put into this.

[quote=“Nueb35, post:9, topic:365234”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=461438.msg3376407#msg3376407 date=1287634500]
Did most of your Java experience come from private servers? LoL
[/quote]

i never understood why this was bad, mine did and i turned out fine…[/quote]

item.title: Simple Chat Server v4
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:11, topic:365234”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=461438.msg3376433#msg3376433 date=1287638077]

Did most of your Java experience come from private servers? LoL

i never understood why this was bad, mine did and i turned out fine…, im taking AP computer science now, easiest shit ever all due to private server experience
[/quote]People that stick to private servers and read the shit “tutorials” at moparscape don’t get anywhere in life.

You obviously are taking a class, and I’m assuming you did some research on the language as well, via google or whatever other medium you felt like using.

That I did, but still I started in servers, so it is a good starting place as long as you expand your horizons and decide to learn the actual language[/quote]You just proved Pwnd’s point by saying “as long as you expand your horizons and decide to learn the actual language”

Just sayin’
